ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Trial number of learning trials
Learning stimulus image name
Task spesific subject id
Elapsed time (milliseconds) from the begging of the task
Phase of the experimental paradigm
Counter of all trials
Browser interactions made by participant
Time to make choice
Key pressed: On choice trials
Key pressed: On memory trials
Notes: 52= High confidence remembered; 53= Low confidence remembered; 54= Low confidence not remembered; 55= High confidence not remembered

ElementDescription: Key pressed: On source memory trials
Notes: 49= 1st block; 50= 2nd block; 51= 3rd block; 52= 4th block; 53= 5th block; 54= 6th block

ElementDescription: Reward probability associated with the 1st option
Reward probability associated with the 2nd option
Reward probability associated with the 3rd option
Reward earned on trial
Block number of learning trials
Trial number of total trials across learning and test phase
Learning background image name
Learning stimulus image name that is to asked to be recalled
Whether the stimulus (probe_img_id) shown was shown in the learning phase
Learning phase trial associated with stimulus (probe_img_id)
Learning phase block associated with stimulus (probe_img_id)
Accuracy of learning phase stimulus recognition
Learning phase stimulus shown during source memory test
Learning phase trial associated with stimulus (probe_source)
Learning phase block associated with stimulus (probe_source)
